alignments.name: NACE Career Competencies
alignments.description: Career readiness is a foundation from which to demonstrate requisite core competencies that broadly prepare the college educated for success in the workplace and lifelong career management. For higher education, career readiness provides a framework for addressing career-related goals and outcomes of curricular and extracurricular activities.

5207fc7c-480c-4e13-8e7d-05ea77a4246b.description: This badge represents the ability to evaluate and engage with global and civic issues in a complex, interdependent world. Badge recipients demonstrate an awareness of how a variety of dynamic contexts shape global and/or civic issues. They explore the social impact of ethical dilemmas, and reflect on the impact their experiences make on the world.
5207fc7c-480c-4e13-8e7d-05ea77a4246b.name: Global Learning and Civic Engagement

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge is able to analyze how interrelated historical/social contexts contribute to the complexity of global and/or civic issue(s), describe multiple positions about an ethical dilemma in specific terms, and analyzes the complexities and social impact of this dilemma. They also analyze global/civic issues using insights gained through one’s own participation in global/civic activities.

2ccc431e-9ea9-4efd-beed-2cc552761546.description: This badge represents your ability to use information, research, and data to effectively identify and solve problems. Expert practitioners of these skills will develop thoughtful hypotheses and detailed plans to research these hypotheses. They will decipher relationships between complex ideas, and propose novel solutions to real-world problems.
2ccc431e-9ea9-4efd-beed-2cc552761546.name: Critical Thinking and Problem Solving

badge_template_activities.title: This project demonstrated the ability to suggest a research question/hypothesis and describe an approach to answering it, including a justification for using this approach. The badge recipient is able to analyze ideas, theories, or issues by offering substantial insight about relationships among their component parts, and describe a problem that arises from actual events in society and describes a range of solutions as well as use research and analysis to justify pursuing a specific solution.

ebe25b90-b11c-4402-94e7-73dff06ddd70.description: This badge represents the successful completion of mentored, self-directed work that enables students to make an original, intellectual, or creative contribution to the discipline by exploring an issue of interest to them and communicating the results to others. The projects have inquiry, design, investigation, discovery and application.
ebe25b90-b11c-4402-94e7-73dff06ddd70.name: Field Work and Research

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients of this badge have participated in semester or year-long field work or undergraduate research working in collaboration with a faculty members in their discipline. Students who receive this badge have successfully developed the skills to operate in the real-world environments of workplaces relevant to their career path, weather that is in a clinical setting for Human Services students or conducting original research in a STEM or Social Sciences.

51fd7c27-2c47-49fa-9518-6c09e4972128.description: This badge represents the ability to make connections between ideas and experiences from different contexts in order to leverage knowledge in new and more meaningful ways. This is informed by Boix-Mansilla’s1 notion of “integrative leverage”, which suggests that quality work integrates different disciplines/methodologies “to generate a new and preferred understanding”. Expert practitioners of these skills will integrate knowledge and modes of thinking from multiple disciplines or perspectives.
51fd7c27-2c47-49fa-9518-6c09e4972128.name: Integrative Knowledge

badge_template_activities.title: The badge recipient successfully Integrates knowledge and approaches from at least two different disciplines / methodologies in planning and conducting research, and critically compares these different approaches. They connect examples of one’s own life experiences and/or prior knowledge to academic texts/ideas to illustrate concepts from multiple perspectives. They situate an issue in a broader historical/social context to demonstrate an understanding of the issue from multiple perspectives.

af399f7d-cb0e-4bcb-835e-62f12b0090cb.description: This badge represents the ability to use numbers and technology to analyze and solve problems. Expert practitioners of these skills will make effective use of quantitative data (including categorical variables) and quantitative methods to analyze an issue or address a problem. They will use the unique and specific features of current digital technologies such as Excel, PowerPoint, and multimedia web sites to complete tasks effectively.
af399f7d-cb0e-4bcb-835e-62f12b0090cb.name: Quantitative Reasoning and the Use of Digital Technologies

badge_template_activities.title: The badge recipient determines trends or relationships using a data set, table, chart, or graph to effectively provide evidence- based arguments about an issue. d418b25e-19af-457d-ab82-9b3e60a7b13e.description: This badge represents your ability to effectively argue and communicate ideas through written, oral, and digital mediums. Expert practitioners of these skills will take into consideration their audience and use appropriate grammatical, organizational, presentation, and stylistic conventions to convey meaning in a persuasive way. They cite relevant information from appropriate sources consistently within each assignment.
d418b25e-19af-457d-ab82-9b3e60a7b13e.name: Written, Oral, and Digital Communication
